attributes.action: Make MPs vote on Brexit in line with their constituents views, not their own
attributes.background:
I believe that any seat where the MP does not support his/her electorate should be deselected as they are not delivering the will of the people who put them into office.
Our MP's have a duty to mirror the opinions of their electorate, not the Westminster bubble.

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
